text: In UI Toolkit, what does the flex-grow property do in a Flexbox layout?

options.text: It defines the ability for a flex item to grow if necessary
It determines the alignment along the main axis
It specifies the initial size of the flex item
It determines if the flex items are laid out in rows or columns

feedbackCorrect: The flex-grow property in a Flexbox layout defines the ability for a flex item to grow if necessary. It accepts a unitless value that serves as a proportion, dictating the amount of space inside the flex container the item should take up.
feedbackIncorrect: In a Flexbox layout, the flex-grow property defines the ability for a flex item to grow if necessary. It does not determine the alignment along the main axis, the initial size of the flex item, or whether the flex items are laid out in rows or columns.
